p: Several preservation techniques, such as refrigeration, synthetic chemical fungicides, modified atmosphere packaging [ 16, 17], osmotic treatments [ 18], hypobaric treatments [ 19], heat treatments [ 9], and edible coatings [ 20], have been used to study the effect on the postharvest decay of strawberries. Research has also encompassed edible coatings with semipermeable films through a reduction of moisture, gas exchange, respiration, and oxidative reaction rates [ 13, 20, 21].
